trans-unit.source: Extracts resources from a BAML file and generates a localized version of a BAML source.
This class is the primary entry point to the BAML localization API.
You must create an instance of this class for each BAML source that you localize.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer"></xref> class with the specified BAML source stream.
A file stream that contains the BAML input to be localized.
source is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer"></xref> class with the specified localizability resolver and BAML source stream.
A file stream that contains the BAML input to be localized.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizabilityResolver"></xref>.
source is .

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer"></xref> class with the specified localizability resolver, BAML source stream, and <xref:System.IO.TextReader>.
A file stream that contains the BAML input to be localized.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizabilityResolver"></xref>.
Reads the localized XML comments associated with this BAML input.
source is .
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer"></xref> encounters abnormal conditions.
Under normal circumstances, <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer> ignores errors and continues localizing the source BAML input.
As a result, the output BAML is partially localized.
By listening for errors this event can be used to stop the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer> and stop processing a source BAML file.
The most common user case where ErrorNotify might be raised is as a result of an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer.UpdateBaml%2A> call where the update contained errors.
For example, the event is raised if an attempted update set a duplicate key, or if the original and update did not have UID values that align.
To be added.
Extracts all localizable resources from a BAML stream.
A copy of the localizable resources from a BAML stream, in the form of a <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizationDictionary"></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer.ErrorNotify"></xref> event.
If you override this method, call base, unless you do not want the derived class to raise the event.
Required event arguments.
Applies resource updates to the BAML source and writes the updated version to a specified stream in order to create a localized version of the source BAML.
The stream that will receive the updated BAML.
The resource updates to be applied to the source BAML.
target or updates are .
